programme.title: Dirty Girl (2010)
programme.desc: In this compassionate comedy-drama, a social misfit named Danielle and a closeted gay teen named Clarke become unlikely friends while living in Oklahoma, and eventually they run away to California to find Danielle's dad.

programme.title: Happy Endings (2005)
programme.desc: The lives of various Los Angelenos are wittily weaved together in this multi-plot character study featuring a stellar ensemble cast led by Lisa Kudrow. She plays a woman who gave up her child for adoption as a teen, and is now being given a chance for a reunion, but with certain strings attached. Jesse Bradford costars as a filmmaker who claims he can get mother and son together. Written and directed by Don Roos. Tom Arnold, Maggie Gyllenhaal, Jason Ritter, Steve Coogan, Laura Dern.

programme.title: Millie Lies Low (2021)
programme.desc: A young woman named Millie struggles to manage her day-to-day life in the face of her mounting anxiety. As she prepares for an internship at a renowned architecture firm in New York City, her first significant opportunity, she experiences the onset of undue panic that results in her missing her long-haul flight from Wellington, New Zealand.

programme.title: Parallel Mothers (2021)
programme.desc: In a maternity ward, two women of disparate backgrounds find their lives entwining in an unexpected way. Middle-aged Janis eagerly awaits her new arrival as Ana, a traumatized teen, fears what the future may hold for her and her new child. As the women navigate the trials of childbirth and the impending expectations of motherhood, they develop an intricate, complex bond that irrevocably alters the course of their lives.

programme.title: The Inevitable Defeat of Mister and Pete (2013)
programme.desc: Youths Mister and Pete must survive on the streets after their parents are arrested. Together, they search for sustenance while attempting to avoid the violence that plagues their neighbourhood in Brooklyn, New York.

programme.desc: After locking himself out of his apartment, an introverted, heartbroken editor finds himself on an epic journey up, down and around his block with life-altering ramifications.

programme.title: Saturday Church (2017)
programme.desc: Fourteen-year-old Ulysses struggles with his sexuality in this musical coming-of-age drama. Under the watch of a suspicious aunt at home, he heads to the Village, where he finds the freedom to explore his true identity.

programme.desc: Bittersweet fare about relationship complications running rampant in an Oregon town awash with lovestruck romantics.

programme.desc: Palatable, fact-based tale of the arrival of California wines on the world stage in the 1970s, and the struggling Napa Valley vintner and British connoisseur in Paris who made it happen.

programme.title: Cosmopolis (2012)
programme.desc: Riding across Manhattan in a stretch limo during a riot in order to get a haircut, a 28-year-old billionaire asset manager's life begins to crumble.

programme.title: Three Women
programme.desc: Gia, a grieving writer, decides to write a book about women's desire. At the center is Lina, a housewife in Indiana; Slaoane, a glamorous entrepreneur in the Northeast and Maggie, a waitress in North Dakota.

programme.title: Three Women
programme.desc: Three women face life's ups and downs, exploring relationships and identity. Their paths cross, leading to surprising connections and personal growth.

programme.title: Titanic (1997)
programme.desc: James Cameron's epic drama centres on the story of star-crossed lovers aboard the doomed luxury liner, as it moves toward its tragic destiny in the icy waters of the North Atlantic. The film broke box-office records and garnered 11 Oscars, including Best Picture and Best Director.

programme.title: Lost Soulz (2023)
programme.desc: A struggling musician gets a break when a group asks him to tour Texas with them. On his journey, he gets a chance to really prove his worth and show what he is made of. This journey across the Lone Star State will give him the tools to grow up and launch his music career.

programme.title: Freedom Hair (2024)
programme.desc: Inspired by a true story, the film centers on Melony Armstrong, a determined mother who starts a natural hair braiding business in Mississippi. She faces resistance from a powerful cosmetology cartel and local laws. She must stand her ground to prove herself to her family and community.

programme.title: Nine Days (2022)
programme.desc: At a waystation in a remote desert, Will, an arbiter, interviews prospective souls for rebirth. Yet the sudden death of a treasured soul upends Will's fragile, unusual existence. Amidst his grief, Will must confront his own arrested potential with the help of the empathetic Emma to achieve catharsis.

programme.title: Swan Song (2023)

programme.title: McVeigh (2024)

programme.title: The Lost Leonardo (2021)
programme.desc: London, England, 2008. Some of the most distinguished experts on the work of Italian artist Leonardo da Vinci (1452-1519) gather at the National Gallery to examine a painting known as Salvator Mundi; an event that turns out to be the first act of one of the most fascinating stories in the history of art.

programme.title: Fitting In (2023)
